Activities & Functions:
The NAEB is the Association of American educational, cultural and public
service radio and television stations. Its services include workshops,
seminars, regional and national annual conferences, personnel upgrading
programs, consultant service, and numerous publications in radio and teleÂ¬
vision, including a monthly Newsletter. It maintains an active production
program (Jeffersonian Heritage. Wavs of Mankind. People Under Communism.
Voices of Europe), and has an exchange-advisory membership relationship
with most national educational organizations. It also exchanges programs
and publications with the radio systems of some 23 foreign countries.
The NAEB also operates a radio network which duplicates via tape
and distributes to member stations several hours of programming per week.
At present there are 75 stations on the network. Since its establishment
in 1951, the Radio Network has distributed to its member stations 211
series of programs totaling 54,529 hours and 12 minutes of programming.
Subscription Rate for the Newsletters $5.00 per year.
